title: serializing large tensors results in system error or zero
body_html:
import torch

a = torch.ones(800*3*480*640)
print(a.eq(0).sum())
torch.save(a, 'a.pth')
b = torch.load('a.pth')

print(b.eq(0).sum())

Running this on OSX:

0
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "a.py", line 5, in <module>
    torch.save(a, 'a.pth')
  File "/Users/soumith/code/pytorch/torch/serialization.py", line 120, in save
    return _save(obj, f, pickle_module, pickle_protocol)
  File "/Users/soumith/code/pytorch/torch/serialization.py", line 192, in _save
    serialized_storages[key]._write_file(f)
RuntimeError: Unknown error: -1

More details of failure in Ubuntu 14.04.1 in https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/value-changed-after-loading-a-saved-tensor/1133

body:
```python
import torch

a = torch.ones(800*3*480*640)
print(a.eq(0).sum())
torch.save(a, 'a.pth')
b = torch.load('a.pth')

print(b.eq(0).sum())
```

Running this on OSX:
```
0
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "a.py", line 5, in <module>
    torch.save(a, 'a.pth')
  File "/Users/soumith/code/pytorch/torch/serialization.py", line 120, in save
    return _save(obj, f, pickle_module, pickle_protocol)
  File "/Users/soumith/code/pytorch/torch/serialization.py", line 192, in _save
    serialized_storages[key]._write_file(f)
RuntimeError: Unknown error: -1
```

More details of failure in Ubuntu 14.04.1 in https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/value-changed-after-loading-a-saved-tensor/1133
